1""" 

2Connection pooling and HTTP client optimization for production workloads. 

3 

4Provides advanced connection management, monitoring, and optimization 

5specifically tuned for OPERA Cloud API patterns. 

6""" 

7 

8import asyncio 

9import logging 

10import time 

11from collections import defaultdict 

12from dataclasses import dataclass 

13from typing import Any 

14 

15import httpx 

16 

17logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) 

18 

19 

20@dataclass 

21class ConnectionMetrics: 

22 """Connection pool metrics.""" 

23 

24 total_requests: int = 0 

25 active_connections: int = 0 

26 idle_connections: int = 0 

27 failed_connections: int = 0 

28 connection_timeouts: int = 0 

29 avg_response_time: float = 0.0 

30 peak_connections: int = 0 

31 last_reset: float = 0.0 

32 

33 

34@dataclass 

35class EndpointMetrics: 

36 """Per-endpoint performance metrics.""" 

37 

38 request_count: int = 0 

39 avg_response_time: float = 0.0 

40 error_count: int = 0 

41 last_error_time: float | None = None 

42 success_rate: float = 1.0 

43 

44 

45class ConnectionPoolOptimizer: 

46 """ 

47 Advanced connection pool optimizer for OPERA Cloud APIs. 

48 

49 Features: 

50 - Dynamic pool sizing based on load patterns 

51 - Per-endpoint connection affinity 

52 - Health monitoring and automatic recovery 

53 - Production-optimized timeouts and limits 

54 """ 

55 

56 def __init__( 

57 self, 

58 base_url: str, 

59 hotel_id: str, 

60 initial_pool_size: int = 20, 

61 max_pool_size: int = 100, 

62 min_pool_size: int = 5, 

63 monitoring_window_seconds: int = 300, 

64 ): 

65 """ 

66 Initialize connection pool optimizer. 

67 

68 Args: 

69 base_url: Base API URL 

70 hotel_id: Hotel identifier 

71 initial_pool_size: Starting pool size 

72 max_pool_size: Maximum connections 

73 min_pool_size: Minimum connections to maintain 

74 monitoring_window_seconds: Metrics collection window 

75 """ 

76 self.base_url = base_url 

77 self.hotel_id = hotel_id 

78 self.initial_pool_size = initial_pool_size 

79 self.max_pool_size = max_pool_size 

80 self.min_pool_size = min_pool_size 

81 self.monitoring_window = monitoring_window_seconds 

82 

83 # Connection metrics 

84 self.metrics = ConnectionMetrics() 

85 self.endpoint_metrics: dict[str, EndpointMetrics] = defaultdict(EndpointMetrics) 

86 

87 # Performance tracking 

88 self._response_times: list[float] = [] 

89 self._request_times: list[float] = [] 

90 

91 # Adaptive settings 

92 self._current_pool_size = initial_pool_size 

93 self._last_optimization = time.time() 

94 self._optimization_interval = 60.0 # Optimize every minute 

95 

96 # Client instance cache 

97 self._clients: dict[str, httpx.AsyncClient] = {} 

98 self._client_locks: dict[str, asyncio.Lock] = defaultdict(asyncio.Lock) 

99 

100 logger.info( 

101 "Connection optimizer initialized", 

102 extra={ 

103 "base_url": base_url, 

104 "hotel_id": hotel_id, 

105 "initial_pool_size": initial_pool_size, 

106 "max_pool_size": max_pool_size, 

107 }, 

108 ) 

109 

110 def get_optimized_client_config( 

111 self, endpoint_pattern: str | None = None 

112 ) -> dict[str, Any]: 

113 """ 

114 Get optimized HTTP client configuration. 

115 

116 Args: 

117 endpoint_pattern: Endpoint pattern for specialized optimization 

118 

119 Returns: 

120 Configuration dictionary for httpx.AsyncClient 

121 """ 

122 # Base configuration optimized for OPERA Cloud 

123 config = { 

124 "timeout": httpx.Timeout( 

125 connect=10.0, # Fast connection timeout 

126 read=45.0, # Generous read for complex queries 

127 write=15.0, # Standard write timeout 

128 pool=60.0, # Pool management timeout 

129 ), 

130 "limits": httpx.Limits( 

131 max_connections=self._current_pool_size, 

132 max_keepalive_connections=max(self._current_pool_size // 2, 10), 

133 keepalive_expiry=30.0, # Keep connections alive for 30 seconds 

134 ), 

135 "http2": True, # Enable HTTP/2 for performance 

136 "verify": True, # Always verify SSL 

137 "follow_redirects": True, 

138 "headers": { 

139 "User-Agent": f"OPERA-Cloud-MCP/{self.hotel_id}", 

140 "Connection": "keep-alive", 

141 "Accept-Encoding": "gzip, deflate", 

142 "Accept": "application/json", 

143 }, 

144 } 

145 

146 # Endpoint-specific optimizations 

147 if endpoint_pattern: 

148 if "reservation" in endpoint_pattern.lower(): 

149 # Reservations may return large datasets 

150 config["timeout"] = httpx.Timeout( 

151 connect=10.0, 

152 read=60.0, # Longer read timeout 

153 write=20.0, 

154 pool=90.0, 

155 ) 

156 elif "report" in endpoint_pattern.lower(): 

157 # Reports can be very slow 

158 config["timeout"] = httpx.Timeout( 

159 connect=15.0, 

160 read=120.0, # Very long read timeout 

161 write=30.0, 

162 pool=150.0, 

163 ) 

164 elif ( 

165 "real-time" in endpoint_pattern.lower() 

166 or "status" in endpoint_pattern.lower() 

167 ): 

168 # Real-time data needs fast responses 

169 config["timeout"] = httpx.Timeout( 

170 connect=5.0, 

171 read=15.0, # Fast read timeout 

172 write=10.0, 

173 pool=30.0, 

174 ) 

175 

176 return config 

177 

178 async def get_optimized_client( 

179 self, endpoint_pattern: str | None = None, client_id: str | None = None 

180 ) -> httpx.AsyncClient: 

181 """ 

182 Get an optimized HTTP client instance. 

183 

184 Args: 

185 endpoint_pattern: Pattern for endpoint-specific optimization 

186 client_id: Unique identifier for client caching 

187 

188 Returns: 

189 Optimized httpx.AsyncClient instance 

190 """ 

191 # Generate client key 

192 if client_id is None: 

193 client_id = f"default_{endpoint_pattern or 'general'}" 

194 

195 # Check if we have a cached client 

196 async with self._client_locks[client_id]: 

197 if client_id in self._clients: 

198 client = self._clients[client_id] 

199 # Check if client is still healthy 

200 if not client.is_closed: 

201 return client 

202 else: 

203 # Client is closed, remove from cache 

204 del self._clients[client_id] 

205 

206 # Create new optimized client 

207 config = self.get_optimized_client_config(endpoint_pattern) 

208 client = httpx.AsyncClient(base_url=self.base_url, **config) 

209 

210 self._clients[client_id] = client 

211 

212 logger.debug( 

213 "Created optimized client", 

214 extra={ 

215 "client_id": client_id, 

216 "endpoint_pattern": endpoint_pattern, 

217 "pool_size": self._current_pool_size, 

218 }, 

219 ) 

220 

221 return client 

222 

223 def record_request_metrics( 

224 self, 

225 endpoint: str, 

226 response_time: float, 

227 success: bool, 

228 error_type: str | None = None, 

229 ) -> None: 

230 """ 

231 Record request metrics for optimization. 

232 

233 Args: 

234 endpoint: API endpoint 

235 response_time: Request response time in seconds 

236 success: Whether request was successful 

237 error_type: Type of error if not successful 

238 """ 

239 now = time.time() 

240 

241 # Update global metrics 

242 self.metrics.total_requests += 1 

243 self._response_times.append(response_time) 

244 self._request_times.append(now) 

245 

246 # Keep only recent response times 

247 cutoff_time = now - self.monitoring_window 

248 self._response_times = [ 

249 rt 

250 for rt, t in zip(self._response_times, self._request_times, strict=False) 

251 if t > cutoff_time 

252 ] 

253 self._request_times = [t for t in self._request_times if t > cutoff_time] 

254 

255 # Update average response time 

256 if self._response_times: 

257 self.metrics.avg_response_time = sum(self._response_times) / len( 

258 self._response_times 

259 ) 

260 

261 # Update endpoint metrics 

262 endpoint_key = self._normalize_endpoint(endpoint) 

263 endpoint_metric = self.endpoint_metrics[endpoint_key] 

264 endpoint_metric.request_count += 1 

265 

266 # Update endpoint average response time 

267 current_avg = endpoint_metric.avg_response_time 

268 count = endpoint_metric.request_count 

269 endpoint_metric.avg_response_time = ( 

270 (current_avg * (count - 1)) + response_time 

271 ) / count 

272 

273 # Update error metrics 

274 if not success: 

275 endpoint_metric.error_count += 1 

276 endpoint_metric.last_error_time = now 

277 

278 if error_type == "timeout": 

279 self.metrics.connection_timeouts += 1 

280 else: 

281 self.metrics.failed_connections += 1 

282 

283 # Update success rate 

284 endpoint_metric.success_rate = 1.0 - ( 

285 endpoint_metric.error_count / endpoint_metric.request_count 

286 ) 

287 

288 # Check if we need to optimize 

289 if now - self._last_optimization > self._optimization_interval: 

290 asyncio.create_task(self._optimize_pool_size()) 

291 

292 def _normalize_endpoint(self, endpoint: str) -> str: 

293 """Normalize endpoint for metrics grouping.""" 

294 # Remove query parameters and IDs for grouping 

295 parts = endpoint.strip("/").split("/") 

296 normalized_parts = [] 

297 

298 for part in parts: 

299 # Replace what looks like IDs with placeholder 

300 if ( 

301 part.isdigit() 

302 or len(part) > 20 # Long strings likely to be IDs 

303 or "-" in part 

304 and len(part) > 10 

305 ): # UUID-like patterns 

306 normalized_parts.append("{id}") 

307 else: 

308 normalized_parts.append(part) 

309 

310 return "/".join(normalized_parts) 

311 

312 async def _optimize_pool_size(self) -> None: 

313 """ 

314 Optimize connection pool size based on current metrics. 

315 """ 

316 self._last_optimization = time.time() 

317 current_time = time.time() 

318 

319 # Calculate recent request rate (requests per second) 

320 recent_requests = len( 

321 [t for t in self._request_times if current_time - t <= 60] 

322 ) 

323 request_rate = recent_requests / 60.0 

324 

325 # Calculate target pool size based on request rate and response times 

326 avg_response_time = self.metrics.avg_response_time 

327 if avg_response_time > 0: 

328 # Estimate concurrent requests: rate * average response time 

329 estimated_concurrent = request_rate * avg_response_time 

330 

331 # Add buffer for peak loads (50% more than estimated) 

332 target_pool_size = int(estimated_concurrent * 1.5) 

333 

334 # Apply bounds 

335 target_pool_size = max( 

336 self.min_pool_size, min(target_pool_size, self.max_pool_size) 

337 ) 

338 

339 # Only adjust if significant change (avoid thrashing) 

340 size_diff = abs(target_pool_size - self._current_pool_size) 

341 if size_diff > 2: # At least 2 connections difference 

342 old_size = self._current_pool_size 

343 self._current_pool_size = target_pool_size 

344 

345 logger.info( 

346 "Optimized connection pool size", 

347 extra={ 

348 "old_size": old_size, 

349 "new_size": target_pool_size, 

350 "request_rate": request_rate, 

351 "avg_response_time": avg_response_time, 

352 "estimated_concurrent": estimated_concurrent, 

353 }, 

354 ) 

355 

356 # Update existing clients with new limits 

357 await self._update_client_limits() 

358 

359 async def _update_client_limits(self) -> None: 

360 """Update limits on existing clients.""" 

361 # Implementation would update existing client limits 

362 pass 

363 

364 def get_pool_health_status(self) -> dict[str, Any]: 

365 """ 

366 Get current connection pool health status. 

367 

368 Returns: 

369 Dictionary with health metrics 

370 """ 

371 now = time.time() 

372 recent_errors = sum( 

373 1 

374 for metric in self.endpoint_metrics.values() 

375 if metric.last_error_time and (now - metric.last_error_time) < 300 

376 ) 

377 

378 # Calculate overall health 

379 total_endpoints = len(self.endpoint_metrics) 

380 unhealthy_endpoints = sum( 

381 1 

382 for metric in self.endpoint_metrics.values() 

383 if metric.success_rate < 0.8 # Less than 80% success rate 

384 ) 

385 

386 health_score = 1.0 

387 if total_endpoints > 0: 

388 health_score = 1.0 - (unhealthy_endpoints / total_endpoints) 

389 

390 # Determine status 

391 if health_score >= 0.9: 

392 status = "healthy" 

393 elif health_score >= 0.7: 

394 status = "warning" 

395 else: 

396 status = "unhealthy" 

397 

398 return { 

399 "status": status, 

400 "health_score": health_score, 

401 "current_pool_size": self._current_pool_size, 

402 "active_clients": len(self._clients), 

403 "total_requests": self.metrics.total_requests, 

404 "avg_response_time": self.metrics.avg_response_time, 

405 "recent_errors": recent_errors, 

406 "unhealthy_endpoints": unhealthy_endpoints, 

407 "endpoint_count": total_endpoints, 

408 "metrics_window": self.monitoring_window, 

409 } 

410 

411 def get_endpoint_statistics(self, limit: int = 10) -> list[dict[str, Any]]: 

412 """ 

413 Get statistics for top endpoints. 

414 

415 Args: 

416 limit: Maximum number of endpoints to return 

417 

418 Returns: 

419 List of endpoint statistics 

420 """ 

421 # Sort endpoints by request count 

422 sorted_endpoints = sorted( 

423 self.endpoint_metrics.items(), 

424 key=lambda x: x[1].request_count, 

425 reverse=True, 

426 ) 

427 

428 return [ 

429 { 

430 "endpoint": endpoint, 

431 "request_count": metrics.request_count, 

432 "avg_response_time": metrics.avg_response_time, 

433 "error_count": metrics.error_count, 

434 "success_rate": metrics.success_rate, 

435 "last_error_time": metrics.last_error_time, 

436 } 

437 for endpoint, metrics in sorted_endpoints[:limit] 

438 ] 

439 

440 async def cleanup(self) -> None: 

441 """Clean up all clients and resources.""" 

442 logger.info("Cleaning up connection optimizer") 

443 

444 # Close all cached clients 

445 for client_id, client in self._clients.items(): 

446 try: 

447 await client.aclose() 

448 logger.debug(f"Closed client: {client_id}") 

449 except Exception as e: 

450 logger.warning(f"Error closing client {client_id}: {e}") 

451 

452 self._clients.clear() 

453 self._client_locks.clear() 

454 

455 # Clear metrics 

456 self.endpoint_metrics.clear() 

457 self._response_times.clear() 

458 self._request_times.clear() 

459 

460 logger.info("Connection optimizer cleanup completed")
